content:
Diagnosis:
Left breast cancer - tall cell papillary carcinoma
Surgery 15 March 2024 - Left wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy

Histology:
Tall cell papillary carcinoma
Grade 2
Lymphovascular invasion absent
Margins clear (>5mm)
Nodes 0/12 positive
ER 8/8, PR 7/8, HER2 3+, Ki67 30%

Previous medical history:
Hypertension
Type 2 diabetes

Current medications:
Metformin 1g bd
Ramipril 5mg od

Allergies:
None known

Current situation:
Post-operative recovery proceeding well
Wound healing satisfactorily
No current symptoms

I reviewed [redacted name] today to discuss adjuvant treatment recommendations. She has made an excellent post-operative recovery with good wound healing. Given her node-negative status but high-risk biological features including Ki67 of 30%, I have recommended adjuvant chemotherapy with docetaxel/carboplatin plus trastuzumab and pertuzumab (TCHP regimen), followed by completion of one year of HER2-directed therapy. We will arrange cardiac echo and baseline blood tests prior to starting treatment. I have also discussed the role of adjuvant endocrine therapy which will commence after chemotherapy completion. [redacted name] understands the treatment plan and wishes to proceed. We will see her next week to commence treatment once preliminary investigations are complete.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: Grade 2 tall cell papillary carcinoma, lymphovascular invasion absent, margins clear >5mm

cancer_timeline.value: Left wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy, nodes 0/12 positive
Histology confirms Grade 2 tall cell papillary carcinoma, triple positive disease with Ki67 30%

status_updates.value: Node negative triple positive breast cancer post surgery. Excellent post-operative recovery, proceeding with adjuvant therapy.
Plan for adjuvant TCHP chemotherapy followed by completion of HER2-directed therapy and endocrine therapy
Cardiac echo and baseline blood tests
Review next week to commence treatment
